1.name: Cancellation
1.desc: Message cancelling a previous transmission for a given transaction.

2.name: Addition
2.desc: Message containing items (e.g. line items, goods items, Customs items, equipment items) to be added to a previously sent message.

3.name: Deletion
3.desc: Message containing items (e.g. line items, goods items, Customs items, equipment items) to be deleted from a previously sent message.

4.name: Change
4.desc: Message containing items (e.g. line items, goods items, Customs items, equipment items) to be changed in a previously sent message.

6.name: Confirmation
6.desc: Message confirming the details of a previous transmission where such confirmation is required or recommended under the terms of a trading partner agreement.

7.name: Duplicate
7.desc: The message is a duplicate of a previously generated message.

9.name: Original
9.desc: Initial transmission related to a given transaction.

10.name: Not found
10.desc: Message whose reference number is not filed.

11.name: Response
11.desc: Message responding to a previous message or document.

12.name: Not processed
12.desc: Message indicating that the referenced message was received but not yet processed.

15.name: Reminder
15.desc: Repeated message transmission for reminding purposes.

17.name: Cancel, to be reissued
17.desc: Referenced transaction cancelled, reissued message will follow.

18.name: Reissue
18.desc: New issue of a previous message (maybe cancelled).

19.name: Seller initiated change
19.desc: Change information submitted by buyer but initiated by seller.

20.name: Replace heading section only
20.desc: Message to replace the heading of a previous message.

21.name: Replace item detail and summary only
21.desc: Message to replace item detail and summary of a previous message.

22.name: Final transmission
22.desc: Final message in a related series of messages together making up a commercial, administrative or transport transaction.

23.name: Transaction on hold
23.desc: Message not to be processed until further release information.

24.name: Delivery instruction
24.desc: Delivery schedule message only used to transmit short- term delivery instructions.

25.name: Forecast
25.desc: Delivery schedule message only used to transmit long-term schedule information.

27.name: Not accepted
27.desc: Message to inform that the referenced message is not accepted by the recipient.

28.name: Accepted, with amendment in heading section
28.desc: Message accepted but amended in heading section.

30.name: Accepted, with amendment in detail section
30.desc: Referenced message is accepted but amended in detail section.

31.name: Copy
31.desc: Indicates that the message is a copy of an original message that has been sent, e.g. for action or information.

32.name: Approval
32.desc: A message releasing an existing referenced message for action to the receiver.

33.name: Change in heading section
33.desc: Message changing the referenced message heading section.

34.name: Accepted with amendment
34.desc: The referenced message is accepted but amended.

35.name: Retransmission
35.desc: Change-free transmission of a message previously sent.

37.name: Reversal of a debit
37.desc: Reversal of a previously posted debit.

38.name: Reversal of a credit
38.desc: Reversal of a previously posted credit.

40.name: Request for deletion
40.desc: The message is given to inform the recipient to delete the referenced transaction.

42.name: Confirmation via specific means
42.desc: Message confirming a transaction previously agreed via other means (e.g. phone).

43.name: Additional transmission
43.desc: Message already transmitted via another communication channel. This transmission is to provide electronically processable data only.

48.name: Accepted, contents rejected
48.desc: Message to inform that the previous message is received, but it cannot be processed due to regulations, laws, etc.

50.name: Withdraw
50.desc: Message withdrawing a previously approved message.

51.name: Authorisation
51.desc: Message authorising a message or transaction(s).

52.name: Proposed amendment
52.desc: A code used to indicate an amendment suggested by the sender.

53.name: Test
53.desc: Code indicating the message is to be considered as a test.
